intro: Peucedanum stricticaule, commonly known as rigid hogweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features tall, straight stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, often with a reddish hue. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are deeply lobed and can be quite large, sometimes reaching up to 30 centimeters in length. Peucedanum stricticaule is known for its strong, aromatic scent and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
